name: Agriculture
description: The crops of the world are in the end, what's going to propel you forward. You should learn about them so that you can be a farming master. Though really it's just if you're hungry, honestly you don't /have/ to read this section.

quests.name: Seeds of Beginning
quests.description: The seed is something that you should get used to. It is at the very heart of Everything that farming is about. But what do you need to know about it exactly?
prerequisites: {Chapter 1 - The Basics}[Putting bread on the table]

tasks.description: How do I mine for Seeds?
tasks.longDescription: To teach this task we're going to start with a simple plant. In this case the pumpkin. They are easy enough to find in the world.

Now.. what can we do with pumpkins? Well a few things actually. But one of the more useful ones is to carve out it's eyes and shove a torch in there. Now to grow a pumkin you're going to need at least one space of normal dirt next to it so it can grow in that direction. Then to harvest it simply use an axe to chop the pumpkin from it's stem. Be sure to leave the stem though. Also a Jack-O-Lantern happens to give off just a hint more light then a torch so try it out.

quests.name: Johnny Appleseed
quests.description: You've probably been finding apples in some of your trees, but did you know you can make APPLE trees? Well you can and it's really quite simple.

tasks.longDescription: Apples are fairly simple fruits, but if you simply place one in your crafting square you can get an apple core

Now you can plant that apple core on any bit of soil you want (tilled or untilled) and it will do the same thing, grow into an apple tree, but you don't need to beat it's leaves off. Simply leave it to grow (Or add some bonemeal) and you will find your tree slowly growing fruits that will eventually fall to the ground.

quests.name: Patti Cake Patti Cake
quests.description: Alright, not quite the right Rhyme. But the point remains that there are a few crops that don't grow... nomrally. Rice happens to be one of them.

tasks.longDescription: Rice is one of a few crops that you can find out in the world. It can be found in gardens, but those don't grow really well. To find some that will grow you will need to use a hoe on normal grass and you might just find some rice.

Rice is an odd plant. It doesn't grow like you might expect. Instead of just tilling soil and having water, you need to Till the Soil, Then using a shovel right click on the soil. THEN with a water bucket fill in the rice paddy, Then you can plant your rice.

quests.name: Hopped Up
quests.description: So Hops are an intersting crop, it like rice grows in a very unique way.

tasks.description: Hop on one foot then two.
tasks.longDescription: Hops themselves are actually pretty easy to find. Simply punch yourself some vines and you have a chance to get hops and another crop we'll talk about in another section of the book.

To grow the hops we're going to need a few things. First those hopes you have you need to turn them into hops seeds (Simply put them in your crafting bench). Then you're going to need some rope and fences. Ropes should be craftable by putting a lead into the crafting block!

The next part of the task is fairly simple. Simply take the fences and put them 3 high on either side of some tilled soil. Then string the rope between them at the top and then run it all the way to the bottom. Hops needs to climb the rope and it can grow a maximum of 3 high

quests.name: In a Jam
quests.description: Like Rice, grapes are somewhat odd. They need a few special things in order to grow.

tasks.longDescription: Grapes are easy enough to find in gardens, but those aren't very good for growing. Instead what we need literally falls off the vine. You're going to need to punch some vines to find the grapes we're looking for.
Like Hops, Grapes need a few things. Some Rope, a few fences, and then of course the grapes themselves, and don't worry we'll let you know how to set this all up.

For Grapes simply till a bit of soil, then put Fences on either side of that 2 high (So one fence on top of another). Then put the Rope between the two fences. Simply plant the grapes and they'll climb up towards the grapes and grow.

quests.name: So long
quests.description: So you're probably getting a bit hungry by now right? Well who can blame you for that, but what if we told you there /was/ an answer for your hunger and it's not powerthirst.

tasks.description: And thanks for all the fish
tasks.longDescription: Mix up 3 fish and some string and you'll get yourself some bait. Throw that bait in a fancy fish trap and then put that fish trap in water and you might just get some fish!

quests.name: Bee Yourself
quests.description: Bees are important to every day life, and some like Einstein even predicted without them the world would end, but have you ever taken a shot at growing some of your own? Well now is your chance.

tasks.description: To Bee or not to Bee
tasks.longDescription: Bee Hives are found all throughout the world of Minecraftia or whatever it is that we're going to call this place. Look in the trees for a small sturcture, destroying it may get you a bee!
Right so you're probably going to need a few flowers and this lovely box to stuff the bees in. The more bees the more honeycomb. Flowers theoretically help with this process. Maybe place them around

You can make all kinds of things with honey, but what in the world do you do to get new bees? Well when your queen bee is exhausted and drained, simply grind her up into royal jelly and mix it with a grub she made, and suddenly you have a new healthy queen bee!

quests.name: Booze!
quests.description: Alright so you may have noticed we have all kinds of ingredients to make the most important thing ever... BOOZE!

tasks.longDescription: There's all kinds of Booze, but to get you started There's 3 Key ways to make it! Let's start with Wine. For this simply put the Fruit Presser down and add the grapes. Now it's going to need a restone source to really get started so we suggest a switch!

Sake and Ale can both be made with the brew Kettle. Simply place water in the brew kettle, light a fire under it (Preferably on Netherrack) and then throw in wheat for Ale, Or some hops For Hopped Ale, or even some rice for Sake.

quests.name: Falling far from the tree
quests.description: So you may have noticed in your exploration of the world, there are these lovely fruit trees. Did you know you can make those?

tasks.longDescription: These are simple enough. All you need to do is find  a fruit tree, and get a fruit from it, then combine it with a sapling!

quests.name: Seedy Buisness
quests.description: So the rest of the world is covered in simple seeds that you don't have to worry about as much. Simply plant it like wheat, carrots or potatos!

tasks.longDescription: We're going to be sending you all over the world, but don't worry you'll get them all eventually, and we want you to have a varied diet. You may have noticed that if you just keep eating the same thing it's not as healthy for you!

quests.name: Crossing the road
quests.description: Why did the chicken cross the road? Well who cares, you need to find some and breed them! Or maybe even eat them.

tasks.description: All the parts of a chicken
tasks.longDescription: Chickens are perhaps the simplest creatures. You can let them simply lay eggs, and then throw those eggs for more chickens, Or you can breed them with seeds!

quests.name: What's that other Berry?
quests.description: There is one last crop that's just a bit odd, The berry crops! These are scattered across the world

tasks.longDescription: Berry's don't need tilled soil. If anything they just need a patch of grass and a bit of space above them to grow up.

quests.name: Beef its whats for dinner
quests.description: There's one final creature that's key to everything. and that is the cow. They won't steer you wrong.

tasks.longDescription: Cows can be bred with wheat, but the important thing is that if you use an empty bucket you can get a bit of milk from them. This will also be a great source of leather.

quests.name: Even the Kitchen Sink
quests.description: Alright so now you have your meat, your vegetables, some fish, and even a few fruits. A complete meal right? Well no you just need a few more tools.

tasks.longDescription: Just be sure to make one of each of these and you'll have everything you need to keep your kitchen fully stocked.

quests.name: Salt makes everything Better
quests.description: Salt, you might find it laying around the world, and even in a bit of water... but for the most part you can dig it up!

tasks.longDescription: Even a wood pick can be used to dig this up! but there's other ways to make salt too. A pot with some water will also net you a bit of salt if you're running low

quests.name: Ooh Ee Ooh
quests.description: Sometimes you just can't get any meat. Well this can help you with that. Tofu is a great alternative to any number of things.

tasks.longDescription: The key to tofu and soy is in fact the soybean. Putting a few of these in the presser will allow you to take it through the various steps. You can press it more and more depending on what you need until it's firm tofu.

quests.name: The Meal
quests.description: Well here we are... you have all the ingredients and the tools, it's time to take you first shot in the ktichen. Why don't you give a shot at making your first huge meal all on your own.

tasks.longDescription: There's a few steps along the way for each ingredient, but it is well worth it in the end because it feels you up entirely

quests.name: Pigging out
quests.description: Another creature that seems fairly tame upon this land that you have stumbled into seems to be the plain and calm Pig. Maybe you could find some and make them useful to yourself!

tasks.longDescription: Pigs are easy enough to breed, they are a little more picky then chickens though in that they very much like carrots. So you should definately get on feeding them that!

quests.name: Don't be a jerk
quests.description: Be a jerky! That is to say that now that you've figured out this salt thing, you might find you can use it for other things too!

tasks.longDescription: Take your favorite meat... or your rotting meat and combine it with a bit of salt and instantly it's more nourishing.

quests.name: Fish without the pole
quests.description: There are some fish and squid in the world that are quite happy to not be caught by a pole, You just find them out in the water. Scavange up a few they're plenty good.

tasks.longDescription: Considered by most to be a passive mob. Squids and Silex meander about the seas. Murder a few to get their precious bits!

quests.name: Lunch on the go
quests.description: Sometimes you want some food, but you only have so much inventory space to work with. It's quite the burden isn't it. Well what if we told you there was a solution to all of this?

tasks.longDescription: The advantage here is you can put all kinds of food in the Lunch Box and it will help you keep yourself nourished. Just use it like you'd be eating and it will choose some food from the pack for you!

quests.name: Pressed for the truth
quests.description: Bees Wax, Honey, and even a few other things can be throwin into a presser, and suddenly you will find yourself with these lovely little easy to use pressed items.

tasks.longDescription: They aren't too tough to make, simply a piston and a bit of wood and you can have your very own presser, and the best benifit? They don't even need power, they just work slowly but surely

quests.name: Play by Candlelight
quests.description: So you've got some wax from your bees right? Well you know you can use that for some fancy things? Well we're here to show you!

tasks.longDescription: A bit of string and some of that wax that you just pressed and you can have your own instant bee based source of light!

quests.name: An extra ingredient
quests.description: So it's not quite sugar, spice, and everything nice. But we do we can make those buckets of booze into something very nice.

tasks.longDescription: You remember those barrels we had you make? Well they aren't useless. Throw your barrels of booze in there and then add some extra ingridents like netherwart and glowstone. Expiriment!

quests.name: Build a bigger box
quests.description: So you can get fish in a trap, but did you know you can get animals too? Well then throw this down and see if you can't catch a bit of fun.

tasks.longDescription: There are 3 kinds of baits in the game Fruit, Grain, and Veggie. Like Fish bait but with well... Fruits, Grains, and Veggies
Now that you have all this bait. You need a box to put this in! Well here is that box.

quests.name: You Churn me on
quests.description: There's a few last kitchen tools that are somewhat useful. From Pepper, to butter.

tasks.longDescription: Milk and Salt in the churn for butter, and then a Pressure plate and peppercorn in the Quern for Pepper. It's all simple enough right?

quests.name: Welch Problems
quests.description: There is /one/ more basic farm animal that you should probably have a handle on (But not that tightly).

tasks.longDescription: The sheep like the cow can be lead and bred with wheat (Oh did we mention that you can lead farm animals with the food you breed them with? If not you can). So we're going to need you to find a few. Also you don't have to murder a sheep for it's wool, you can just use shears. In addition you can dye them and all their children will share that color!

quests.name: This little Piggy
quests.description: Sometimes you have scoured the world and even then you can't find the seeds you're looking for. Well this handy tool can help you out with that problem.

tasks.longDescription: Markets can be used to exchange valuable emeralds for seeds that you might have trouble finding or getting access to.

quests.name: Cooking Made Easy
quests.description: So who can really be bothered to remeber ALL those recipies that you need to make for cooking? It's terrible right. Well it's time for you to learn a new way.

tasks.longDescription: It's time for a good old fashion book burning. So get yourself a plain book and throw it in the furnace! It will tell you what you can craft from the items in your inventory!

Who wants to simply be told what they can make when you can something ALSO make it for you. Combining your fancy cookbook with a few other things, you will now be able to start CRAFTING food from your inventory.

So who wants to take up valuable inventory space with food? Not I. The Fridge can store your food, the sink can give you fresh water, the stove can cook your meats and store a few tools, and finally the Cooking table is your centerpiece. This multiblock kitchen with the right tools will allow you to cook just about anything you have in your fridge or inventory!
